Title:
Two new species of Phylloporia (Hymenochaetales) from
Ecuador
Abstract:
Two new species of Phylloporia, P. crystallina and P.
sumacoensis, are described based on morphology, phylogeny, host, and
geographic distribution. Phylloporia crystallina is characterized by
pileate and perennial basidiocarps with duplex context, small pores 910
per mm, a monomitic hyphal system, the absence of cystidia and
cystidioles, the presence of large rhomboid crystals in tube trama,
broadly ellipsoid basidiospores to subglobose measuring 2.83 × 22.3 μm,
and growth on angiosperm stump. Phylloporia sumacoensis is characterized
by pileate and perennial basidiocarps with duplex context, very small
pores 1012 per mm, a monomitic hyphal system, hyphae at dissepiment
edges bearing fine crystals, the presence of cystidioles, broadly
ellipsoid to subglobose basidiospores measuring 33.7 × 2.12.8 μm, and
growth on living liana. The samples of the two new species nested in the
Phylloporia clade by the nuc 28S rDNA-based phylogeny, forming two new
terminal lineages.
